author: Special Correspondent
text:
Turmeric traders have announced a 10-day break in procurement at four centres in the district later this month.

Temple festivities

Members of the Erode Manjal Vanigargal Matrum Kidangu Urimaiyalargal Sangam have decided not to take part in the auction at the Integrated Centre at Karumandisellipalayam, and three other centres, in view of the festivities at Bannari Amman and Erode Mariamman temples, holi, and Good Friday.

The Sangam members will not take part in the auction from March 22 to April 1, its secretary SKM Sathyamoorthy said.

The Sangam’s announcement coincides with weak arrivals.

At present, the new variety is being brought from Karnataka.

However, the supply from Andhra Pradesh and Maharashtra has weakened due to unfavourable monsoon rains.

The turmeric markets in the Northern States are also witnessing dull business, according to Mr. Sathyamoorthy.

According to the traders, increase in turmeric production corresponds with favourable Southwest monsoons.

Prices

The slide in arrival is the cause for remunerative prices. Turmeric cultivators in the district say the procurement rate at around Rs. 9,000 per quintal is conducive.

Since the start of the year, there has been stability in the rate of finger and root varieties that are traded in Erode district.

The auction centres in the district are operated by the Erode Turmeric Merchants Association; Regulated Marketing Committee; and Erode and Gobichettipalayam Cooperative Marketing Societies.

The Sangam members will not take part in the auction from March 22 to April 1
title: Turmeric traders announce 10-day break in business
